meanings.definition: A vivid blue pigment originally made from lapis lazuli.
meanings.sent1: The artist used ultramarine to paint the sky in the picture.
meanings.sent2: The ultramarine color of the ocean was breathtaking.
meanings.sent3: The ultramarine paint tube jumped out of the box, eager to be used.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes sparkled like ultramarine gems in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The ultramarine hue of the flower stood out among the rest.

meanings.definition: A deep blue color resembling the pigment ultramarine.
meanings.sent1: The dress she wore was a beautiful shade of ultramarine.
meanings.sent2: The ultramarine of the sky at dusk was mesmerizing.
meanings.sent3: The ultramarine color seemed to dance on the canvas.
meanings.sent4: His voice was as smooth and rich as ultramarine velvet.
meanings.sent5: The ultramarine of the sea reflected the clear sky above.

meanings.definition: Situated or originating from beyond the sea.
meanings.sent1: The ultramarine ship sailed gracefully on the horizon.
meanings.sent2: She dreamt of visiting distant lands with ultramarine waters.
meanings.sent3: The ultramarine explorer set off on a quest for hidden treasures.
meanings.sent4: His stories were filled with tales of ultramarine adventures.
meanings.sent5: The ultramarine flag fluttered proudly on the foreign shore.
